document.docTitle: Wulfila conchamonile Rivera-Quiroz & Álvarez-Padilla 2019, spec. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: Description of five new Wulfila (Araneae, Anyphaenidae) species from Mexico with comments on the taxonomy of the genus

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Description of five new Wulfila (Araneae, Anyphaenidae) species from Mexico with comments on the taxonomy of the genus

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type material:
Holotype ♀ :
MEXICO :
San Luis Potosí
: Xilitla , Xilitla City near Las Pozas ( 21°23’50’’N , 98°59’38’’W ,
685 m
),
Aug. 27–31, 2011
, F.A. Rivera-Quiroz leg. ( CNAN-T01346 )
.
Paratypes :
All the following, same data as holotype except as noted
:
1 ♂ ,
Aug. 27–31, 2011
, U. Garcilazo-Cruz leg. ( CNAN-T01345 )
.
1 ♂ ,
Nov. 14–18, 2011
, U. Garcilazo-Cruz leg. ( CNAN )
.

.

.

.

August 27–31, 2011

.

Further material examined :
MEXICO :
San Luis Potosí
: With same locality as holotype,
Aug. 27–31, 2011
, 1♀
;
Nov. 14–18, 2011
, 1♀ , 1♂
; Mar. 23–30, 2012 , 5♀ , 9♂ ; and Jun. 10–15, 2012 , 5♂ ;
for all previous: U. Gar- cilazo-Cruz, D. E. Álvarez-Martinez , M. A. Hernández-Patricio , F. J. Salgueiro-Sepúlveda , F.A. Rivera-Quiroz and R . S. González-Contreras leg. ( CAFC )
.
Etymology: The species epithet, a noun in apposition, from the Latin concha (pearl) and monile (necklace) refers to the shape of the final portion of the copulatory duct.

Diagnosis: Male pedipalp of
W. conchamonile
spec. nov.
differs from that of
W. albens
( Platnick 1974 : fig. 83, 84) by lacking a bifurcation on the distal portion of the MA and having a longer bRTA ( Figs 1f ; 3a , c–d). Female genitalia of
W. conchamonile
spec. nov.
differ from all other
Wulfila
species by having very long Cd with semispherical sac-like structures ( Figs 2e ; 3 e–f).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1a–f.
Wulfila conchamonile
spec. nov.
, male. Habitus: a —dorsal, b —lateral, c —ventral. Palp: d —dorsal, e —retrolateral, f —ventral. Scale bars: a–c = 0.5 mm, d–f = 0.2 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Female: As in male except as noted ( Figs 2 a–e; 3e–f).Total length 4.12. Cephalothorax: length 1.62; width 1.12. Chelicera: width 0.23, length 0.52; five promarginal and eight retromarginal teeth; fang 0.30. Clypeus slightly higher than in male. Coxae II–IV with dark prolateral markings. Abdomen: without lateral spots ( Fig. 2b ); ventral surface with, one dark spot near the tracheal spiracle ( Fig. 2c ). Legs length: I 12.50; II 6.25; III 4.37; IV 7.75. Pedipalp 2.20. Epigyne: red, with semi-transparent cuticle; Co in a shallow atrium ( Fig. 2d ; 3f ). Vulva: Cd long and narrow, with a great number of sac-like sections that resembles a pearl necklace; S sub-spherical; Fd short and narrow projecting anteriorly ( Figs 3 e–f).

Variation: Males : total length mean 3.65 (range: 3.50 to 3.80), carapace length mean 1.40 (range: 1.37 to 1.60); width mean 1.07 (range: 1.0 to 1.25). Females : total length mean 4.12 (range: 4.0 to 4.20), carapace length mean 1.50 (range: 1.50 to 1.60); width mean 1.05 (range: 1.0 to 1.12). In both sexes some specimens show darker markings and a few do not show markings at all.
Distribution: Known only from the type locality ( Fig. 15a ).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 2a–e.
Wulfila conchamonile
spec. nov.
, female. Habitus: a —dorsal, b —lateral, c —ventral. Epigyne: d —ventral, e —dorsal (cleared). Scale bars: a–c = 0.5 mm, d , e = 0.1 mm.

FIGURES 3a–f.
Wulfila conchamonile
spec. nov.
, genitalia. Male palp: a —ventral, b —prolateral, c —dorsal, d —retrolateral. Epigyne: e —dorsal, f —ventral. Scale bars: a–d = 0.3 mm, e–f = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Biology: All specimens were collected in a tropical forest with secondary plant growth. Most specimens were caught by beating and direct collecting from vegetation; one specimen was collected in the leaf litter.
